text: @JESSIEEDSELL21 its actually because you only hear about the good games from failed systems. everyones forgotten about the bad ones, which were much more common. nothing special about failed systems, just selection bias. cheers
author: bsznm

text:
@JESSIEEDSELL21 People have started to recognize their roots in the world of retrogames, and they may want to pay some homage to them.

I, on the other hand, have never owned classic or "failed" systems, but I want to know where it all started from, anyway. I can't probably enjoy them the same way kids back then did (and someone might bash me for that), but I can enjoy them nevertheless.
author: sinituuke

text: why is i that failed systems always have a charm to them? dont get me wrong im not saying the genesis was a failure it was by no means a failure but im saying that this game was released when the genesis wasnt to popular back in 89 the genesis didnt take off until 91 it seems that the game early on for genesis had a charm that couldnt be beat.
